data: In Clifden, the chief coast town of Connemara, there is a house at the end of a triangle which the two streets of the town form, the front windows of which look straight down the beautiful harbour and bay, whose waters stretch out beyond the islands which are scattered along the coast and, with the many submerged reefs, make the entrance so difficult.
browsing: literature|browsing: science-fiction & fantasy|category: science-fiction & fantasy|category: novels|category: british literature
